intro: Epilobium trilectorum, commonly known as the three-leaved willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, often disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges. Epilobium trilectorum is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
